text: my name is Sam Buxton and this is my
fianc√© Pam errands damn we met at a bar
in midtown Manhattan and we got set up
by one of our mutual friends and
actually the afternoon of the day I was
at work and I called a friend that set
us up and I could barely breathe I was
so sick she said you know you just have
to go it'll be fine you know he'll see
they were sick he'll really appreciate
you you know you went out of your way
and I can remember you know sitting
across from her at the table watching
her you know barely breathing and just
thinking myself god this is not going
well she's not having a fun time I just
don't think she really liked me and to
my surprise around eight thirty in the
morning on friday morning i actually got
an email from her saying dear Sam you
know I'd love to see you again sometime
soon and I can remember just like my
heart literally dropped and a couple
girls in my office you know helped me
craft an email to sound suave and cool
and I guess it worked being around Sam
he sort of opened me up and help me make
you know put my guard down and showed me
that there were other things out there
and that I didn't have to be scared that
he was going to help me and it would be
okay so I decided to propose almost a
little over two years into our
relationship thinking about the proposal
I knew I wanted to do something a little
unique different and I knew I didn't
want to be in New York so I prefaced it
by saying Pam hey do you want to go to
Bermuda for a long weekend so about a
week before we left her mom actually
called and said oh you know I went out
and I bought you guys a copy of travel
boggle so you know fast forward a week
got to the hotel and I suggest to Pam
you know your mom bought us boggle why
don't we you know play a quick game of
boggle while we wait for the BBQ to heat
up nothing anything of it she said sure
why not so I came out and brought the
boggle and place it on the table and
said okay you know let's let's start
playing I picked up the boggle was about
to shake the tiles up when I looked down
and I realized that we were already
missing a tile I kept insisting as a Pam
I said listen I said don't worry about
it I have the
tile and I looked down and I read
happily marry me and I just sort of
stared at the tiles and then all of a
sudden I looked up and I think at this
point I'd actually started to cry and
saw say I've kneeling on one knee with
the ring in his hand and he said will
you marry me and I said yes and the rest
is history
